notes.content:
=== Financial Analysis ===
â€¢ "Summarize this month's P&L for Company Code 1000 and highlight the top 5 variances vs budget by cost center. Explain the main drivers in business language."

â€¢ "Compare Q1 2025 actuals vs plan for revenue and EBITDA by segment. Flag any deviations greater than 10% and propose likely reasons based on available data."

=== Cash Flow & Collections ===
â€¢ "Forecast 13-week cash flow for our US entity based on open AR/AP and historical patterns. Highlight weeks with potential shortfalls."

â€¢ "List customers with overdue receivables > 60 days and highest risk. Propose prioritized collection actions and draft email templates for top 10 accounts."

â€¢ "Analyze our DSO trend for the last 12 months and suggest process changes to reduce DSO by 5 days."

=== Period Close & Reconciliation ===
â€¢ "Show me an overview of period-end close status for Company Code 1000 for March 2025 and list tasks at risk of delay."

â€¢ "Identify the top 20 open items blocking GR/IR clearing and suggest how to resolve them, including which business users to involve."

=== Accounts Payable ===
â€¢ "Create a draft supplier invoice from this purchase order and attached PDF and route it for approval according to our workflow."

â€¢ "Identify suppliers with frequent invoice blocking reasons (price variance, quantity variance, missing PO) and recommend preventive actions."

=== Profitability Analysis ===
â€¢ "Analyze gross margin by product group for the last quarter and show the 10 products with the largest margin erosion vs last year. Provide hypotheses."

â€¢ "For Customer X, show revenue, margin, open orders, and open disputes for the last 12 months and classify the customer's profitability."

=== Planning & Forecasting ===
â€¢ "Generate a rolling 12-month revenue and OPEX forecast using the last 24 months of data and current open orders. Present best, base, and worst-case scenarios."

â€¢ "Simulate a 5% increase in raw material costs and show the impact on contribution margin by product line."

=== Compliance & Audit ===
â€¢ "Identify unusual journal postings in the last quarter (e.g., large manual entries, postings outside business hours) and group them by risk indicator."

â€¢ "List key SoD (segregation of duties) violations detected in finance-related roles and propose mitigation options."

=== Natural Language Navigation ===
â€¢ "Explain the difference between margins in the P&L and contribution margin in CO-PA for my company in simple terms."

â€¢ "Guide me step-by-step through posting an accrual for marketing expenses in S/4HANA Cloud."

=== Cross-Functional Scenarios ===
â€¢ "For materials with negative margin in the last 3 months, combine finance and supply chain data to show purchase prices, selling prices, and stock levels, and suggest corrective actions."
notes.title: Joule Prompts Library - S/4HANA Finance & ERP

notes.content:
S/4HANA Cloud User License Ratios:

1 Advanced User = 1 FUE
5 Core Users = 1 FUE
30 Self-Service Users = 1 FUE
Developer = 1 FUE (Always)

What Each Type Means:
â€¢ Advanced User - Full access to all transactions
â€¢ Core User - Limited to specific business processes
â€¢ Self-Service User - Basic read/write (e.g., expense reports)
â€¢ Developer - Full development and customization access

Example Calculation:
50 Advanced + 200 Core + 600 Self-Service + 10 Developers
= 50 + 40 + 20 + 10
= 120 FUE total

Key for Sizing Projects:
Always calculate FUE during discovery to size licenses correctly.
notes.title: S/4HANA FUE Ratios
